data.text: @chly1017fm All of Vancouver Island moving in the right direction (well, except for Victoria, but we will let that slide). #COVID19BC https://t.co/awHybddjcL
@MickSweetman Thank you again for publishing these amazing charts
@chly1017fm The MSP testing rates for anyone under 80 in B.C. are very low, but thankfully the positivity rates have also been falling. #COVID19BC https://t.co/pdQbg3r5YD

Covid case rates are down in all three Health Service Delivery Areas on Vancouver Island. Other regions in B.C. look pretty similar. See the @chly1017fm website for updated case and testing charts: https://t.co/le3hzHpH6S #covid19bc https://t.co/DtpsR4fO1K

It's been a couple of weeks since I looked at regional #COVID19 case rates in B.C. and cases are significantly down in all regions. The Lower Mainland has the lowest rate but not by a lot. #COVID19BC https://t.co/4Kep14ss1b

@MickSweetman Even if testing is terrible like so many want to believe it is, ICU and deaths the only stats that really matter and can’t be false cause if you’re dying from Covid you’re going to go to the hospital, definitely good sign icu being so low.

@VCHhealthcare B.C. saw 14 #COVID19 deaths reported in the past 24 hours for a total of 2,929. The seven-day average is seven deaths a day.

The new deaths include:
Fraser Health: six
Vancouver Coastal Health: three
Island Health: five

 #COVID19BC https://t.co/mKmCQvV0Zg

The daily hospitalization numbers have been a bit wonky lately, but even with 37 Covid hospitalizations removed from @VCHhealthcare's total today (no explanation why) there were 38 more hospitalizations reported and the seven-day average went up to 54 a day. #COVID19BC https://t.co/zNge1bNVmf
